Quotation.ab: From Revāyāt Kamdīn Shapur Unvala, 1922 (v. II, p. 23)

yas̱ā ʾhū vīryū ās̱ravaḫšū frā mī mrūtī va rāspī as̱ā ratūš kardan va pas dast bevaraq kāġaz kardan marot̰. ahurō. mazdā̊. pas tā čahārom tamām kardan pas rāspī āv pādyāb kardan zūd dast šostan ẏānīm. manō. tā aϑā. vaxṣ̌iiā. ahurəm. mazdą̇m. goftan pas panǧom pargard tā šašom tamām kardan dast šostan tāvə̄. uruuātā. tā ahunuuitiiā pas ẏā. š́iiaoϑnā. goftan pas dast bevaraq kardan tā bīst va duwum pargard tamām kardan

yaϑā ahū vairiiō [[yō]] āϑrauuaxšō frā mē mrūtē and the rāspīg recites aϑā ratuš and then (the zōt) puts the hand over the leaf of the book (and recites) mraōt̰ ahurō mazdā̊ until the fourth completely. Then the rāspīg brings the water and the pādyāb and the zōt was his hands. (Then) say yānīm. manō until at̰. tā. vaxṣ̌iiā. (and) ahurəm. mazdąm.. Then the fifth and the sixth fragard should be recited completely and the hands washed. (Then) say tā və̄ uruuātā until ahunauuaitiiā̊ and then yā š́iiaōϑnā. Then (the zōt) puts the hand over the leaf (and so) until he completes the twenty second fragard.
Therefore, at least at the time of the Revāyats only the parts of the fragards where recited by reading a book.
